title: Time Mastery Theory v2.3.1: Temporons Framework for Dark Matter and Dark Energy
description: The Time Mastery Theory (TMT) v2.3.1 proposes that dark matter (25%) and dark energy (70%) emerge from temporons - time particles with infinite range. The theory is based on temporal superposition: |Ψ⟩ = α|t⟩ + β|t̄⟩, where matter exists in a quantum superposition of forward and backward time states. The backward-time component manifests as apparent dark matter. Key innovation: Φ_T(ρ=1) = 0 ensures exact compatibility with CMB and BAO observations. Validated on 2.4 million galaxies: 175 SPARC (97% improvement), 1M KiDS-450 (isotropic halos), 1.18M COSMOS2015 (mass-environment r=0.150). Combined statistical significance: p = 10⁻¹¹² (>15σ). Score: 6/6 cosmological tests passed. H₀ tension 100% resolved.
notes: TMT v2.3.1 introduces temporons - time particles with infinite range. Key property: Φ_T(ρ=1) = 0 ensures exact CMB/BAO compatibility. Results: (1) SPARC rotation curves: 97% of 175 galaxies improved, (2) Universal law r_c(M) validated (r=0.768, p=3×10⁻²¹), (3) COSMOS2015: 1.18M galaxies, mass-environment correlation r=0.150 (p<10⁻¹⁰⁰), (4) KiDS-450: 1M galaxies confirm isotropic halos, (5) CMB/BAO: identical to ΛCDM at high density, (6) H0 tension: 100% explained. Combined statistical significance: p = 1.36 × 10⁻¹¹² (>15σ). Total galaxies analyzed: 2.4 million.
references: Lelli, McGaugh & Schombert (2016). SPARC: Mass models for 175 disk galaxies. AJ, 152, 157.
Laigle et al. (2016). The COSMOS2015 Catalog. ApJS, 224, 24.
Hildebrandt et al. (2017). KiDS-450: Cosmological parameter constraints. MNRAS, 465, 1454.
Scolnic et al. (2022). The Pantheon+ Analysis. ApJ, 938, 113.
Riess et al. (2022). A Comprehensive Measurement of H0. ApJ, 934, L7.
Planck Collaboration (2020). Planck 2018 results. VI. Cosmological parameters. A&A, 641, A6.
Di Valentino et al. (2021). In the realm of the Hubble tension. Class. Quantum Grav. 38, 153001.
